citation: Proclamation under the Highways Act 1951 and the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Highways Act 1951 and the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 3 of the Highways Act 1951 and section 7 of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 –

        (a) notify the dedication as a highway of the land of the Crown specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation; and
        (b) notify that the boundaries of the highway are the boundaries specified in that Part of that Schedule; and
        (c) declare the portions of road specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation to be a State highway for the purposes of Part II of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 ; and
        (d) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
26 April 2005

W. J. E. COX

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

BRYAN GREEN

Minister for Infrastructure, Energy and Resources

SCHEDULE 1 - Dedication of Crown land as a highway

PART 1 - Description

Name  Description  Length in kilometres  Tasman Highway  From the existing Tasman Highway at a point 570 metres south of its junction with Vicary Street at Triabunna to the existing Tasman Highway at a point 110 metres north of its junction with Vicary Street at Triabunna, the boundaries of which are shown by heavy black lines on Plan 6739 in the Central Plan Register.  0.68
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         


PART 2 - Interpretation

In this Schedule –
    existing means existing as at the date of this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - State highway

PART 1 - Description

Name  Description  Length in kilometres  Tasman Highway  From the existing Tasman Highway at a point 570 metres south of its junction with Vicary Street at Triabunna to the existing Tasman Highway at a point 110 metres north of its junction with Vicary Street at Triabunna, the boundaries of which are shown by heavy black lines on Plan 6739in the Central Plan Register.  0.68
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        


PART 2 - Interpretation

In this Schedule –
    existing means existing as at the date of this proclamation.

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 4 May 2005

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
